train_x = train_x.reshape((train_x.shape[0], n_steps, 1, n_length, n_features))
Listing 20.32: Example of preparing data for the ConvLSTM2D encoder model.
We can then deﬁne the encoder as a ConvLSTM hidden layer followed by a ﬂatten layer
ready for decoding.
# define convlstm input model
model.add(ConvLSTM2D(filters=64, kernel_size=(1,3), activation=' relu' ,
input_shape=(n_steps, 1, n_length, n_features)))
model.add(Flatten())
Listing 20.33: Example of deﬁning the ConvLSTM2D encoder model.
